meanings.sent1: She objected to the new rule at school.
meanings.sent2: He always objects when his sister takes his toys.
meanings.sent3: The cat objected to wearing a tiny hat.
meanings.sent4: The old tree objected to the harsh winds by bending gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The child objected loudly to eating vegetables.

meanings.definition: To present a reason or argument against something.
meanings.sent1: They objected to the proposal due to its high cost.
meanings.sent2: The lawyer objected during the trial to protect her client's rights.
meanings.sent3: The dog objected to taking a bath by hiding under the bed.
meanings.sent4: Her heart objected to the idea of leaving her hometown.
meanings.sent5: The student objected with valid points in the class debate.

meanings.sent1: The workers objected to the new work schedule.
meanings.sent2: She objected to the idea of moving to a different city.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel objected to sharing its nuts with the birds.
meanings.sent4: The waves objected to the calmness of the lake by crashing against the shore.
meanings.sent5: The team objected strongly to the unfair decision by the referee.
